Description: Lid of a limestone anthropoid coffin of Padihorhephep, the figure wears a broad collar with a pectoral, elaborated with a representation of Osiris, Isis and Horus seated, the body is elaborated with six vertical registers of hieroglyphic text which names the deities and contains formulae for the acceptance of the deceased into the after-life, the text is flanked by representations of the four Sons of Horus and other funerary deities, partly restored.
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Sons of Horus
Acquisition name: Donated by: Spencer Joshua Alwyne Compton, 2nd Marquess of Northampton
